commit_message:
Fix containerized logrotate configuration

Use copytruncate and 'hourly' log rotation by default.  Increase the
default max number of rotated files to 336, which corresponds to 14
days, so that default period retained as is.

With the copytruncate option enabled, logs should be hourly rotated to
decrease disk IO load when copying log files around. The default
maxsize of 10M is better maintained for often rotations done within a
day as well, so log files will not happen to become unexpectedly huge
at the end of it.

W/o copytruncate, the containerized logrotate sends no signals to
processes, as files are only renamed and not unlinked. That makes the
files deletion based filter failing, until the default period of 14
days expires. To fix that non-copytruncate case, post-rotate always
sends HUP (USR1 for httpd) signals to all processes holding open files
in the /var/log/containers host path. That also makes all services
reloaded hourly (there is still a random splay applied by cron though)
as a side effect.

With copytruncate ON, each rotation ensures the old log files will also be
deleted, so only affected services will be reloaded.

Additionally, send USR1 instead of HUP to reload httpd in containers
gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1785659

Change-Id: I15fa0eab1625ac63fd57b6a6d5cd22a6ac85f221
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/13/589213/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Logrotate's copytruncate is used by default for containerized services logs rotation. The default period to keep old logs remains unchanged (14 days), but rotation will happen on hourly basis instead of daily. That means that old log files will be maintained for 336 versions of it, which represents 14 days multiplied by 24 hours per a day. fixes: - | Containerized logrotate configuration ensures httpd processes running in containers will be reloaded gracefully via SIGUSR1. Containerized servicies will reliably reopen its logfiles when logrotate happens.

commit_message:
Fix containerized logrotate configuration

Use copytruncate and 'hourly' log rotation by default.  Increase the
default max number of rotated files to 336, which corresponds to 14
days, so that default period retained as is.

With the copytruncate option enabled, logs should be hourly rotated to
decrease disk IO load when copying log files around. The default
maxsize of 10M is better maintained for often rotations done within a
day as well, so log files will not happen to become unexpectedly huge
at the end of it.

W/o copytruncate, the containerized logrotate sends no signals to
processes, as files are only renamed and not unlinked. That makes the
files deletion based filter failing, until the default period of 14
days expires. To fix that non-copytruncate case, post-rotate always
sends HUP (USR1 for httpd) signals to all processes holding open files
in the /var/log/containers host path. That also makes all services
reloaded hourly (there is still a random splay applied by cron though)
as a side effect.

With copytruncate ON, each rotation ensures the old log files will also be
deleted, so only affected services will be reloaded.

Additionally, send USR1 instead of HUP to reload httpd in containers
gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1785659

Change-Id: I15fa0eab1625ac63fd57b6a6d5cd22a6ac85f221
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d24df2d26905ef92c17e325ccd6a2f5765972f61)

Containerized servicies will reliably reopen its logfiles when logrotate happens.

Containerized servicies will reliably reopen its logfiles when logrotate happens.

commit_message:
Increase default is ready retries

The current number of is ready retries does not work with DSS9000
hardware.  This change doubles the number of retries, which has proven
to work.

Change-Id: I5651acbb22be1cffb2a7f448db6a6975d27ad963

commit_message:
Disable password auth on dib images

Glean only configures key based authentication credentials. There is no
reason to allow password auth so disable it. This shouldn't be necessary
as no accounts allow password auth in /etc/shadow anyway but this gives
us security in layers like onions and ogres.

Change-Id: Ie17aa901eb3fe7387707a236287a3e880990eeb2

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained
project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ifb460199c94d748988d4f0e836e90d1dd6f294bc
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix tests.detection.test_mon

Static class variables of FakeProcesses class were used in all test
methods. These variables were used in an uncoordinated way causing tests
to fail ocassionally, depending on the grouping and ordering of the
tests in the worker processes.

Code has been refactored and instance variables are used now in all test
methods.

Change-Id: Ic87a00883dc6cff128809f24164d95eb8c98ae91
Story: 2002848
Task: 22797

commit_message:
fix mistral dashbaord workflow execution form bug

fix a bug that when a workflow has no input params, execution form
will has a requried field with empty label

Close-bug:#1786723
Change-Id: I49b2125ef649e94e210ff5df739684626c175172

commit_message:
blacklist bad versions of etcd3gw

Both of these versions have the python3 encoding problem described in
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/133191.html

Change-Id: I4003fca955b9dcecbb6ba8b98b4b200079ea5b76
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use lbproxy instead of lbagent in neutron when deploy Octavia

Disable neutron-lbaas-agent and use lbaasv2-proxy  when enable octavia.
Use keystone-auth v3 and internal endpoint for lbaasv2 plugin.

Change-Id: I69e8436f3722cf99644457323b71b94dc9036bb9
Co-Authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq2@viettel.com.vn>
Closes-Bug: #1756771
Closes-Bug: #1738115

deleted_lines: enabled: "{{ enable_neutron_lbaas | bool and neutron_plugin_agent not in ['vmware_nsxv', 'vmware_dvs'] }}" enabled: "{{ enable_neutron_lbaas | bool }}"

and then work on fixing at least the version caps in Stein.

commit_message:
Exclude eventlet 0.22.0 and 0.24.0

Block the following releases:
eventlet-0.22.0.tar.gz                                 : 2018-01-12T00:07:40
eventlet-0.22.1.tar.gz                                 : 2018-02-17T18:12:57
eventlet-0.24.0.tar.gz                                 : 2018-08-01T17:27:52

We've been manually excluding these releases from upper-constraints and
we have OpenSTack libraries with old caps which are incompatible with
the newer releases.

For example:
 os-xenapi 0.3.3 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 neutron-lbaas 12.0.0 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 networking-sfc 6.0.0 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 os-win 4.0.0 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 jaeger-client 3.11.0 has requirement opentracing<2,>=1.2.2, but you'll have opentracing 2.0.0 which is incompatible.
 networking-odl 12.0.0 has requirement websocket-client<=0.40.0,>=0.33.0, but you'll have websocket-client 0.48.0 which is incompatible.
 neutron-fwaas 12.0.0 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 neutron 12.0.3 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 neutron-dynamic-routing 12.0.1 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.

So lets block these in global-requirements to make things clear in Rocky
and then work on fixing at least the version caps in Stein.

Change-Id: I93ee2167e6a5a06e4542e0edc870f60c2468edd4

commit_message:
Block opentracing 2.0.0

Currently jaeger-client doesn't work with 2.x so let block it for now.

jaeger-client 3.11.0 has requirement opentracing<2,>=1.2.2, but you'll have opentracing 2.0.0 which is incompatible.

Change-Id: I4cf85a91914de7d1f2092a91b68cd8c60e00fd29

commit_message:
Add common base class for test cases

Adds a base class that includes parts common to API and scenario tests.

Change-Id: I1485228520d641d94bf9a1f5c7bbb2a306b63bf2
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Make use of service clients interface

This change makes use of features provided by stable "ServiceClients"
interface that has been available in Tempest for some time. The
interface enhances tests with a convenient way to access available
service clients.

When a plugin uses "ServiceClients" interface, all stable Tempest
clients and all clients exposed by installed plugins will be
automatically available and pre-configured. Instead of explicitly
specifying parameters, such as "auth_provider", "build_timeout", etc.,
all these parameters will be read from the Tempest configuration and
then installed automatically in the clients.

Plugin adaptation was carried out in accordance with the requirements
described in Tempest documentation[1] and inspired by changes introduced
in other plugins[2][3].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/plugin.html#service-clients
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/338486/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/334596/

Change-Id: I0fbb12fb93f4411f23d95d54d8d5a7904a372333
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-tempest-plugin refs/changes/24/587824/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Enhances tests with a convenient way to access available service clients configured for a specified set of credentials. """ def __init__(self, credentials, service=None): if CONF.identity.auth_version == 'v2': identity_uri = CONF.identity.uri else: identity_uri = CONF.identity.uri_v3 super(Manager, self).__init__(credentials, identity_uri)

commit_message:
Flatten service clients and tests directories

Looking at the structuring of service clients among Tempest plugins,
almost none of them places clients in "json" subfolder. Similarly,
almost none of the plugins places tests for different APIs into
individual directories such as: flavors, limits etc.. In particular,
such conventions do not occur in the Tempest repository, on which
plugins should be modeled.

This change reorganizes plugin directories in order to comply with
Tempest standards.

Change-Id: I7c967f70a10b9cab5d29c9d6b961f6e36d6eb600
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Add metadata-list to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the metadata-list command.

The trove command metadata-list is now:
    openstack database metadata list

Change-Id: I790985a9c1ce7e7b5868d2f2e2bd915397353b15
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/52/583952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - The command ``trove metadata-list`` is now available to use in the python-openstackclient CLI as ``openstack database metadata list``
